column1: The main airport serving the city is the Grand Bahama International Airport
column2: which receives domestic flights from various islands of the Bahamas as well as several international flights from the United States and Canada. Freeport is also served by domestic Bahamian ferry services to other islands.

column1: Freeport is located just 117 kilometres (73 mi) off the coast of Palm Beach
column3: and on the major EW–NS shipping routes. This has positioned it as an ideal centre for international business. Consequently

column1: Parks include the Rand Nature Centre
column2: named after its founder James Rand; Petersons Cay
column3: a small isle about 300 yards off the shore of Grand Bahama; and the Lucayan National Park founded by Peter Barratt
column4: a former architect and town planner of Freeport. The Lucayan National Park is 16 hectares (40 acres) in extent and includes five ecological zones stretching from the south shore to the pineyard.  There is an extensive underwater cave system beneath the park. One cave entrance is accessible by stairs at the national park
column5: while other caves are accessible for certified scubas.

column1: Freeport features a tropical rainforest climate
column2: similar to South Florida's. According to Köppen Climate Classification (Af)
column3: more specifically with hot humid conditions that vary only a little throughout the year. Seldom do temperatures drop below 16 °C (60 °F). Average temperatures are around 27 °C (80 °F)
column4: with water temperature varying between 22 to 26 °C (72 to 78 °F). The winters are usually mild and dry (with the exception of some rainfall due to cold fronts)
column5: while the summers are usually hot and wet. Although a freeze has never been reported in the Bahamas
column6: snow was reported to have mixed with rain in Freeport in January 1977
column7: the same time that it snowed in the Miami area. The temperature was about 4.5 °C (40.1 °F) at the time.

column1: Tourism draws more than 1 million visitors per year

column5: Hurricane Dorian moved over the area and stalled for over a day
column6: causing extensive devastation. Several cruise ships stop weekly at the island. Much of the tourist industry is centered on the seaside suburb of Lucaya
column7: owing its name to the pre-Columbian Lucayan inhabitants of the island evidence of whom has been found on the island. Freeport features at least two Junkanoo festivals near New Year's.

column1: The city is often promoted as Freeport/Lucaya. Most hotels on the island are located in Lucaya along the southern shore facing the Northwest Providence Channel. The primary shopping venue for tourists is the Port Lucaya Marketplace in Lucaya. Recovery from the 2004 Hurricanes Jeanne and Frances took nearly a decade and led to closure of the older shopping venue International Bazaar and neighboring Bahamas Princess Resort and Casino.
